alert.note: Alert for Washington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 09 at 1:00AM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Washington and central Greene Counties through 145 AM CST... At 100 AM CST, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 13 miles east of Richton to 7 miles northwest of Leakesville to 8 miles east of McLain. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Chatom, Leakesville, Deer Park, Tibbie, State Line and Fruitdale. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
